questions.question_text: What is a component of the first stage of an application development CI/CD pipeline?

choices.B: commitment and pushing of code into a version control system
choices.C: triggering of the automated build phase
choices.A: triggering of the automated testing phase
choices.D: developer writing the initial lines of code

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
"The first step in setting up a CI/CD pipeline is development. Developers code and push their code to a shared repository like Git."

Source: https://www.browserstack.com/guide/building-ci-cd-pipeline

questions.question_text: What must be created on a network to enable devices in different network segments to communicate as if attached to the same wire?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
"VLANs provide a way to group devices within a LAN. A group of devices within a VLAN communicate as if they were attached to the same wire. VLANs are based on logical connections, instead of physical connections"

Source: https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2181837&seqNum=4

questions.question_text: When a developer sends an HTTP request to an API, which two elements are expected in an HTTP response? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
The answers are correct.

https://developer.edgecast.com/cdn/api/Content/Introduction/Common_Request_and_Response_Elements.htm

It's correct, as we are deleting a menbership, so we need the menbership id not the personId.
The membership id is the "Vwwww....."

Shouldn't the last one be Vyyy...?
Since it says "personId" and after it says "personDisplayName" that is referred to Developer1

C. organize code in a reusable way

Organizing data into functions is a programming practice that helps in encapsulating the logic that operates on the data, making the code modular, maintainable, and reusable. Functions allow developers to create blocks of code that perform specific tasks, which can be called from various places within a program without the need to duplicate code.

Selected Answer: C
I think is correct

questions.question_text: What is the benefit of organizing data into functions?

choices.A: supports using same variable in different modules
choices.B: supports altering the state of an object
choices.C: organize code in a reusable way
choices.D: stores data values of different types
